author: Staff Reporter
text:
Courting fresh controversy Bharatiya Janata Party State president Dilip Ghosh threatened to “beat up” students of Jadavpur University for raising “pro-Pakistan” slogans in the campus. He was speaking at a party rally at Gosaba in South 24 Parganas district.

Mr. Ghosh, who had earlier threatened to “drag out anti-nationals” from the campus, said on Saturday, “Such slogans [pro-Pakistan] are being raised inside the Jadavpur University (JU) campus. Let them come outside and we will beat good sense into them. You people live here and chant Pakistan Zindabad.”

He also said such students will be beaten “black and blue.”

Following the arrest of Jawaharlal Nehru University students’ union president Kanhaiya Kumar on charges of sedition, the State BJP has been raising its pitch over alleged “pro-Afzal [Guru]” slogans at a rally of JU students in support of Mr. Kumar.

Mr. Ghosh has also targeted Vice Chancellor Suranjan Das for “failing” to identify the students concerned and dubbed him a “Trinamool Congress appointee.”

Earlier in the week at Suri in Birbhum district, Mr. Ghosh threatened to “behead” those who raise “Pakistan Zindabad” slogans in Bengal.

title: Bengal BJP chief threatens Jadavpur students again
